member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor
member.summary: The TfsSharedQueryProcessor enabled you to migrate queries from one locatio nto another.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor.MigrateFolder(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryHierarchy,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder)
member.summary: Define Query Folders under the current parent
member.param: The object that represents the whole of the target query tree
The source folder in tree on source instance
The target folder in tree on target instance

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor.MigrateQuery(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryHierarchy,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryDefinition,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder)
member.summary: Add Query Definition under a specific Query Folder.
member.param: The object that represents the whole of the target query tree
Query Definition - Contains the Query Details

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions
member.summary: The `TfsSharedQueryProcessor` enabled you to migrate queries from one location to another.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.PrefixProjectToNodes
member.summary: Do we add the source project name into the folder path

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.SharedFolderName
member.summary: The name of the shared folder, made a parameter incase it every needs to be edited

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.SourceToTargetFieldMappings
member.summary: Mapping of the source to the target

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessor
member.summary: Native TFS Processor, does not work with any other Endpoints.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.MigrateTeamSettings
member.summary: Migrate original team settings after their creation on target team project

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.UpdateTeamSettings
member.summary: Reset the target team settings to match the source if the team exists

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.PrefixProjectToNodes
member.summary: Prefix your iterations and areas with the project name. If you have enabled this in `NodeStructuresMigrationConfig` you must do it here too.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.MigrateTeamCapacities
member.summary: Migrate original team member capacities after their creation on the target team project. Note: It will only migrate team member capacity if the team member with same display name exists on the target collection otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.Teams
member.summary: List of Teams to process. If this is `null` then all teams will be processed.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsAttachmentToolOptions.ExportBasePath
member.summary: `AttachmentMigration` is set to true then you need to specify a working path for attachments to be saved locally.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsAttachmentToolOptions.MaxAttachmentSize
member.summary: `AttachmentMigration` is set to true then you need to specify a max file size for upload in bites. For Azure DevOps Services the default is 480,000,000 bites (60mb), for TFS its 32,000,000 bites (4mb).

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool
member.summary: The TfsNodeStructureToolEnricher is used to create missing nodes in the target project. To configure it add a `TfsNodeStructureToolOptions` section to `CommonEnrichersConfig` in the config file. Otherwise defaults will be applied.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool.ShouldCreateNode(System.String)
member.summary: Checks node-to-be-created with allowed BasePath's
member.param: The user-friendly path of the source node

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool.CheckIsParentOfSelectedBasePath(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a path is a parent of a selected base path (meaning we cannot skip it entirely)
member.param: The user-friendly path of the source node
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the path is a parent of any positively selected base path.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.NodeBasePaths
member.summary: The root paths of the Ares / Iterations you want migrate. See [NodeBasePath Configuration](#nodebasepath-configuration)

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.AreaMaps
member.summary: Remapping rules for area paths, implemented with regular expressions. The rules apply with a higher priority than the `PrefixProjectToNodes`, that is, if no rule matches the path and the `PrefixProjectToNodes` option is enabled, then the old `PrefixProjectToNodes` behavior is applied.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.IterationMaps
member.summary: Remapping rules for iteration paths, implemented with regular expressions. The rules apply with a higher priority than the `PrefixProjectToNodes`, that is, if no rule matches the path and the `PrefixProjectToNodes` option is enabled, then the old `PrefixProjectToNodes` behavior is applied.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.ShouldCreateMissingRevisionPaths
member.summary: When set to True the susyem will try to create any missing missing area or iteration paths from the revisions.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerTool
member.summary: The TfsRevisionManagerTool manipulates the revisions of a work item to reduce the number of revisions that are migrated.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerToolOptions.ReplayRevisions
member.summary: You can choose to migrate the tip only (a single write) or all of the revisions (many writes). If you are setting this to `false` to migrate only the tip then you should set `BuildFieldTable` to `true`.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerToolOptions.MaxRevisions
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of revisions that will be migrated. "First + Last N = Max". If this was set to 5 and there were 10 revisions you would get the first 1 (creation) and the latest 4 migrated.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsTool
member.summary: The TfsUserMappingTool is used to map users from the source to the target system. Run it with the ExportUsersForMappingContext to create a mapping file then with WorkItemMigrationContext to use the mapping file to update the users in the target system as you migrate the work items.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.MigrateTeamSettings
member.summary: Migrate original team settings after their creation on target team project

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.UpdateTeamSettings
member.summary: Reset the target team settings to match the source if the team exists

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.MigrateTeamCapacities
member.summary: Migrate original team member capacities after their creation on the target team project. Note: It will only migrate team member capacity if the team member with same display name exists on the target collection otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.Teams
member.summary: List of Teams to process. If this is `null` then all teams will be processed.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingTool
member.summary: The TfsUserMappingTool is used to map users from the source to the target system. Run it with the ExportUsersForMappingContext to create a mapping file then with WorkItemMigrationContext to use the mapping file to update the users in the target system as you migrate the work items.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingToolOptions.IdentityFieldsToCheck
member.summary: This is a list of the Identiy fields in the Source to check for user mapping purposes. You should list all identiy fields that you wan to map.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingToolOptions.UserMappingFile
member.summary: This is the file that will be used to export or import the user mappings. Use the ExportUsersForMapping processor to create the file.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsWorkItemLinkToolOptions.FilterIfLinkCountMatches
member.summary: Skip validating links if the number of links in the source and the target matches!

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsWorkItemLinkToolOptions.SaveAfterEachLinkIsAdded
member.summary: Save the work item after each link is added. This will slow the migration as it will cause many saves to the TFS database.
